original: HENNIG, Bernt Emil Olof, Textilingenjör, Borås, f 29/3 10 aV ingenjör K H H o Anna Bengtsson, gm Barbro Jacobson. Realex, avg.-ex fr Högre facksk f Textilindustri, Chemnitz. Prakt.anst längre o kortare perioder h fl sv textilfabr, d:o h schweiziska o tyska textilmaskinfabr. Ag fastigh Rydet 87 i Sandhults s :n. Textiling o styr.led i AB Hugo Hennig, Borås. Resor: Tyskl, Danm, Norge, Tjeckosl, Schweiz, Italien. Frimurare. Hobbies: Segling, fiske, filateli o foto. °HENNING, Karl Alfred, Kapten, Direktör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 9/1 91 av bagerifabr C B H o Ellen Martin, gm Anna Gunhild Katarina Berg. Resoffex 15, kapt 30. Yrkesutbild bagare med gesällbrev 10, verksam inom bageribranschen sed. 11. Vkst dir i Mineralvattenfabr AB Svalan 28, i AB J Landelius hovkonditori sed. 29 (grund 58) samt i konditori AB Ekorren, styr.ordf i Norra Bageri AB, ordf i Sv Bageriidk.frn sed. 29 o i La federation intern de la Boulangerie industrielle fr 36. Stdsflm 33—é2, led av löneavtalsnmd 34, hälsov.nmdns rev 33—36, fattigv.nmdns rev 34— 35, rev i slakthus- o saluhallsstyr 33—34, suppl i industriverksstyr 34, nykterh.nmd 36 o i Sthlms stads arb.förmedl 37, led av Allm Valm.frbs kretsstyr f Sthlm 33—36.
translated:
HENNIG, Bernt Emil Olof, Textile Engineer, Borås, b. 29/3 1910, son of engineer K H H and Anna Bengtsson, m. Barbro Jacobson. Graduated from Realex, completed the Higher Technical School for Textile Industry in Chemnitz. Worked as an apprentice for various Swedish textile factories, as well as Swiss and German textile machine factories for both shorter and longer periods. Owns property Rydet 87 in Sandhults parish. Works in textile production and serves on the board of directors for AB Hugo Hennig in Borås. Has traveled to Germany, Denmark, Norway, Czechoslovakia, Switzerland, and Italy. Freemason. Hobbies include sailing, fishing, philately, and photography.

°HENNING, Karl Alfred, Captain, Director, Stockholm, b. Stockholm 9/1 1891, son of bakery factory owner C B H and Ellen Martin, m. Anna Gunhild Katarina Berg. Commissioned officer 1915, promoted to Captain in 1930. Professionally trained baker with journeyman certificate in 1910, working in the bakery industry since 1911. Became managing director of AB Svalan Mineral Water Factory in 1928, AB J Landelius confectionery since 1929 (founded in 1958), and confectionery AB Ekorren. Chairman of the board in Norra Bageri AB and chairman of the Swedish Bakery Industry Association since 1929, as well as chairman of the international federation of industrial bakeries since 1936. Active in the cinema industry from 1933 to 1942, member of the wage agreement committee in 1934, member of the health committee review from 1933-1936, member of the poor relief committee review from 1934-1935, member of the slaughterhouse and market hall board review from 1933-1934, alternate member of the industrial works board in 1934, member of the temperance board in 1936, and member of the Stockholm Employment Exchange from 1937. Member of the district board for Stockholm of the General Election Workers' Association from 1933-1936.

education.educationalLevel: Graduated from Higher Technical School for Textile Industry
